clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Anesthetic Blockades on Pain Modulation in Migraine

brief_summary.textblock: Greater occipital nerve (GON) anesthetic blockades are widely used for the treatment of headaches, yet its efficacy in migraine has hardly been assessed with controlled studies. The aim of this study is to evaluate the short-term clinical efficacy of GON anaesthetic blockades in chronic migraine and to analyze their effect on pressure pain thresholds (PPTs) in different areas. We hypothesize that those patients receiving real GON anesthetic blockade will receive greater improvements in pain nociception. We will conduct a double-blind, randomized, parallel and placebo-controlled clinical trial where one group will be treated with bilateral GON blockade with bupivacaine 0,5% and the other group will be treated with placebo.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in the number of days with moderate/intense migraine
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (1 week before) and 1 week after intervention
primary_outcome.description: A headache diary will register the number of days with moderate/intense migraine. Moderate/intense migraine is considered a headache with an intensity level over 4 points on a numerical pain rate scale (NPRS, 0-10)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the number of days with mild/moderate migraine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (1 week before) and 1 week after intervention
secondary_outcome.description: A headache diary will register the number of days with mild/moderate migraine. Moderate/intense migraine is considered a headache with an intensity level under 4 points on a numerical pain rate scale (NPRS, 0-10)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the number of symptomatic medication drugs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (1 week before) and 1 week after intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The subjects will register in the headache diary the number of days per week in which they need symptomatic medical drugs for relief the headache attack

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 hour after and 1 week after intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Pressure pain thresholds will be assessed over the supraorbital, infraorbital and mental nerves, and over the second metacarpal and tibialis anterior muscle

arm_group.description: Patients will receive a bilateral greater occipital nerve blockade with bupivacaine 0,5%
Patients will receive a bilateral occipital injection with isotonic saline

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Chronic migraine
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other primary headaches
- Other secondary headaches
- Co-morbid medical diseases
